name: Benjamin Taylor v. Margaret Evans, Appellant

judges: Before Sterrett C. J., Green, McCollum, Mitchell and Dean, JJ.
parties: Benjamin Taylor v. Margaret Evans, Appellant.

opinions.text:
Opinion by
Mr. Justice Green,
For the reasons expressed in the opinion in the case No. 222, July T., 1895, Evans v. Taylor, supra, 286, the defense set up in Üiis case must be pronounced invalid and, therefore,
The judgment is affirmed.
opinions.author: Mr. Justice Green,

casebody.head_matter:
Benjamin Taylor v. Margaret Evans, Appellant.
October 5, 1896 :
Argued March 26, 1896.
Appeal, No. 221, July T., 1895, by defendant, from judgment of C. P. No. 2, Fhila. Co., June T., 1892, No. 676, on verdict for defendant.
Before Sterrett C. J., Green, McCollum, Mitchell and Dean, JJ.
Affirmed.
J. Howard Morrison, for appellant.
William H. Peace, for appellee.
